member.name: M:BeeApi.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.name: M:BeeApi.Providers.CustomJwtFormat.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:BeeApi.Providers.CustomOAuthProvider.ValidateClientAuthentication(Microsoft.Owin.Security.OAuth.OAuthValidateClientAuthenticationContext)
member.summary: Called to validate that the origin of the request is a registered "client_id", and that the correct credentials for that client are present on the request. If the web application accepts Basic authentication credentials, context.TryGetBasicCredentials(out clientId, out clientSecret) may be called to acquire those values if present in the request header. If the web application accepts "client_id" and "client_secret" as form encoded POST parameters, context.TryGetFormCredentials(out clientId, out clientSecret) may be called to acquire those values if present in the request body. If context.Validated is not called the request will not proceed further.
member.param: The context of the event carries information in and results out.

member.name: M:BeeApi.Providers.CustomOAuthProvider.GrantResourceOwnerCredentials(Microsoft.Owin.Security.OAuth.OAuthGrantResourceOwnerCredentialsContext)
member.summary: Called when a request to the Token endpoint arrives with a "grant_type" of "password". This occurs when the user has provided name and password credentials directly into the client application's user interface, and the client application is using those to acquire an "access_token" and optional "refresh_token". If the web application supports the resource owner credentials grant type it must validate the context.Username and context.Password as appropriate. To issue an access token the context.Validated must be called with a new ticket containing the claims about the resource owner which should be associated with the access token. The application should take appropriate measures to ensure that the endpoint isn’t abused by malicious callers. The default behavior is to reject this grant type. See also http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.3.2
member.param: The context of the event carries information in and results out.

member.name: M:BeeApi.Startup.ConfigureOAuthTokenGeneration(Owin.IAppBuilder)
member.summary: Configures the o authentication token generation.

member.name: M:BeeApi.Startup.ConfigureOAuthTokenConsumption(Owin.IAppBuilder)
member.summary: Configures the o authentication token consumption.
